# DockAccessory.CameraInformation

**Structure**

A collection of tracking information about the camera currently in use.

## Declaration

```swift
struct CameraInformation
```

## Overview

Use this class in conjuction with [doc://com.apple.DockKit/documentation/DockKit/DockAccessory/track(_:cameraInformation:)-4yl9b] and [doc://com.apple.DockKit/documentation/DockKit/DockAccessory/track(_:cameraInformation:)-44mwn].

## Creating the object

- **init(captureDevice:cameraPosition:orientation:cameraIntrinsics:referenceDimensions:)**: Creates an object that describes the camera in use for tracking.

## Getting camera information

- **cameraPosition**: The physical position of the capture device.
- **cameraIntrinsics**: A matrix that represents the characteristics of the lens.
- **captureDevice**: The capture device generating the video.
- **orientation**: The orientation of the capture device.
- **referenceDimensions**: The size of the video frame.

## Selecting and tracking

- **selectSubject(at:)**: Selects a subject to track at the supplied coordinates.
- **track(_:cameraInformation:)**: Automatically generate and send tracking vectors to the device.
- **track(_:cameraInformation:)**: Automatically generate and send tracking vectors to the device.
- **DockAccessory.Observation**: An observation of the contents of a single video frame.
- **DockAccessory.CameraOrientation**: The set of camera orientations used to extract coordinates.

## Conforms To

- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
